Surrogates¶

Package related to surrogate models.

Classes summary¶

Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate(…)

Abstract class for surrogate models.

Surrogates.BNN_MCD.BNN_MCD(f_sim_archive, …)

Class for Bayesian Neural Network with Monte Carlo Dropout (mono and multi dimensional targets).

Surrogates.BNN_BLR.BNN_BLR(f_sim_archive, …)

Class for Bayesian Neural Network with Bayesian Linear Regressor (mono dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.KRG.KRG(f_sim_archive, pb, …)

Class for Kriging surrogate model (mono dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.GP_RBF.GP_RBF(f_sim_archive, pb, …)

Class for Gaussian Process model with Radial Basis kernel function (mono dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.GP_Matern.GP_Matern(…)

Class for Gaussian Process model with Matern kernel function (mono dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.GP_SMK.GP_SMK(f_sim_archive, pb, …)

Class for Gaussian Process model with Spectral Mixture kernel (mono dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.GP_Multitask_RBF.GP_Multitask_RBF(…)

Class for Gaussian Process multitask model with Radial Basis kernel function (multi dimensional targets only).

Surrogates.RF.RF(f_sim_archive, pb, …)

Class for Random Forest model (mono and multi dimensional targets).

Surrogate (abstract)¶

class Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate(f_sim_archive, pb, n_train_samples, f_train_log, f_trained_model)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class for surrogate models.

Parameters

  • f_sim_archive (str) – filename where are stored the past simulated individuals

  • pb (Problem) – problem the surrogate is associated with

  • n_train_samples (positive int or inf, not zero) – number of training samples to extract from the end of f_sim_archive, if float(‘inf’) all the samples from f_sim_archive are considered

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model

abstract perform_prediction(candidates)¶

Returns the predicted cost of the candidates and the uncertainty around it.

Parameters

candidates (np.ndarray) – candidates

Returns

predicted costs and uncertainties

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray)

perform_distance(candidates)¶

Returns the distance from each candidate to the set of past simulated individuals.

Parameters

candidates (np.ndarray) – candidates

Returns

distances from the candidates to the set of past simulated individuals

Return type

np.ndarray

abstract perform_training()¶

Trains the surrogate model.

load_sim_archive()¶

Returns the past simulated individuals.

Returns

past simulated decision vectors along with their cost

Return type

tuple(np.ndarray,np.ndarray)

abstract load_trained_model()¶

Loads a model trained in the past.

Approximated Bayesian Neural Network¶

Monte Carlo Dropout¶

class Surrogates.BNN_MCD.BNN_MCD(f_sim_archive, pb, n_train_samples, f_train_log, f_trained_model)¶

Bases: Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate

Class for Bayesian Neural Network with Monte Carlo Dropout (mono and multi dimensional targets).

Parameters

  • f_sim_archive (str) – filename where are stored the past simulated individuals

  • pb (Problem) – problem the surrogate is associated with

  • n_train_samples (positive int or inf, not zero) – number of training samples to extract from the end of f_sim_archive, if float(‘inf’) all the samples from f_sim_archive are considered

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model (str) – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model

  • y_bounds (np.ndarray) – lower and upper bounds of the costs found in the training set.

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Keras model for the network

perform_prediction(candidates)¶

Returns the predicted cost of the candidates and the uncertainty around it.

Parameters

candidates (np.ndarray) – candidates

Returns

predicted costs and uncertainties

Return type

(np.ndarray, np.ndarray)

Trains the surrogate model.

past simulated decision vectors along with their cost

Bayesian Linear Regressor¶

class Surrogates.BNN_BLR.BNN_BLR(f_sim_archive, pb, n_train_samples, f_train_log, f_trained_model)¶

Bases: Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate

Class for Bayesian Neural Network with Bayesian Linear Regressor (mono dimensional targets only).

Parameters

  • f_sim_archive (str) – filename where are stored the past simulated individuals

  • pb (Problem) – problem the surrogate is associated with

  • n_train_samples (positive int or inf, not zero) – number of training samples to extract from the end of f_sim_archive, if float(‘inf’) all the samples from f_sim_archive are considered

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model (str) – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model

  • model (pybnn.DNGO) – DNGO model for the network

Radial Basis Function¶

class Surrogates.GP_RBF.GP_RBF(f_sim_archive, pb, n_train_samples, f_train_log, f_trained_model)¶

Bases: Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate

Class for Gaussian Process model with Radial Basis kernel function (mono dimensional targets only).

Parameters

  • f_sim_archive (str) – filename where are stored the past simulated individuals

  • pb (Problem) – problem the surrogate is associated with

  • n_train_samples (positive int or inf, not zero) – number of training samples to extract from the end of f_sim_archive, if float(‘inf’) all the samples from f_sim_archive are considered

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model (str) – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model

  • likelihood (gpytorch.likelihoods.GaussianLikelihood) – likelihood function

  • model (gpytorch.models.ExactGP) – Gaussian Process model

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model (str) – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model

class Surrogates.RF.RF(f_sim_archive, pb, n_train_samples, f_train_log, f_trained_model)¶

Bases: Surrogates.Surrogate.Surrogate

Parameters

  • pb (Problem) – problem the surrogate is associated with

  • n_train_samples (positive int or inf, not zero) – number of training samples to extract from the end of f_sim_archive, if float(‘inf’) all the samples from f_sim_archive are considered

  • f_train_log (str) – filename where will be recorded training log

  • f_trained_model (str) – filename where will be recorded the trained surrogate model
